bibdata.title: Create a checklist in confluence of what needs to be done after cloning the alma sandbox from production - include the link in bibdata
i1874: deploy as bibdata, not marc_liberation

comments.body:
Discussed with @acozine and @kayiwa the https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/pull/2781. @acozine will  update the pr to ensure that it renames the directory and not deletes it. 
We will test the updated https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/pull/2781 pr on bibdata-staging. 
We want to make sure that files in directory with name `marc_liberation_files` will not be deleted when we change it to `bibdata`: 
data/marc_liberation_files -> /data/bibdata_files , 
/data/marc_liberation_files/scsb_update_files -> /data/bibdata_files/scsb_update_files,
/data/marc_liberation_files/figgy_ark_cache -> /data/bibdata_files/figgy_ark_cache,
/data/marc_liberation_files/partner_update_scratch -> /data/bibdata_files/partner_update_scratch

To test:

- [x] Run the updated playbook. @acozine will let us know when it's ready to test. we tested on staging.
- [x] Deploy this bibdata branch to bibdata-staging
- [x] Trigger an incremental publishing job in the Alma sandbox. it indexed the files
- [x] Import a daily update from scsb. It indexed the files
- [x] Trigger a General publishing job in the alma sandbox. triggered on 08/12/22
- [x] Make sure the files will transfer in the right directories in bibdata-staging
- [x] Make sure the incremental files will be indexed.
- [x] triggered a request for full files from HL
- [x] trigger an import of the full pertner files
- [x] Make sure you can run a full reindex. We started the PUL full reindex around 10:15am 08/12/22.
- [ ] In order to run the playbook on bibdata production make sure that will happen not in hours that we get incremental files from Alma. The files are initializing in Alma at 4am, 10am, 4pm, 10pm and are in bibdata in the next 60 mins. during maintenance window. Take one machine at aa time.
we have tested this pr and https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/pull/2781 in bibdata-stgaing and bibdata-qa. We will run both in bibdata production on 08/16/22

dacs_handbook.title: Run all the Rails app playbooks this week

comments.body: Thanks @kelynch for walking us through this. Now Neggin and I are clear how to create a new collection through the DSpace UI: go to the community, click "Create collection" button, leave preliminary settings at default, give the collection a name (no other details needed), add the EPerson who needs to submit to that collection, and then add the "ResearchDataReviewer" group to the "Accept/Reject/Edit Metadata Step".

There still appear to be network connectivity problems, and these now seem to affect both the `production` and `dev` environments:

```
$ date                                                                                                                 
Mon Aug 15 11:21:23 EDT 2022
$ curl -v https://princeton.elements.symplectic.org:8091/secure-api/v5.5
*   Trying 147.135.6.233...
* TCP_NODELAY set
^C
$ date                                                                                                                
Mon Aug 15 11:21:33 EDT 2022
$ curl https://checkip.amazonaws.com
137.83.217.149
```

I have attempted to further diagnose this, but could not resolve this without assistance. Please note that I have requested further assistance from the Digital Science migration team:

https://3.basecamp.com/3804430/buckets/26643531/todos/4720742011#__recording_5229383727

orangelight.title: Deprecate Integration with Borrow Direct API for "Resource Sharing" requests

comments.body:
Looking at the codebase I see there are already a few files related to borrow direct that don't seem to be used

https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/main/app/models/concerns/requests/bd_utils.rb
https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/main/app/models/requests/borrow_direct_lookup.rb

This is the file where the current behavior that tries a BD request, followed by an ILLiad request is present. 

https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/ddb644404b5471b5c7d263efc9f62be017ef0b1e/app/models/requests/submissions/borrow_direct.rb

Our new state when ReShare is launched will be to just execute this method https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/ddb644404b5471b5c7d263efc9f62be017ef0b1e/app/models/requests/submissions/borrow_direct.rb#L72 for every item. At some point ReShare may have an API where we can return to the former behavior but as I understand thing will be available post-launch.
